title: clang wrapper behaves differently than clang on OSX
body:
This is on MacOS high sierra

balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ sw_vers 
ProductName:	Mac OS X
ProductVersion:	10.13
BuildVersion:	17A405


I see spack is using the wrapper lib/spack/env/clang/clang instead of /usr/bin/clang

Perhaps there is a valid reason for this. But I have 2 issues with it:

1. It behaves differently than /usr/bin/clang. Why?

```
     17    checking for gcc... /Users/balay/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang
     18    checking whether the C compiler works... yes
     19    checking for C compiler default output file name... a.out
     20    checking for suffix of executables...
  >> 21    checking whether we are cross compiling... configure: error: in `/private/var/folders/b2/4wzkzbgs3d91kqp1dw47wq940000gn/T/balay/spack-stage/spack-stage-4h3G7M/pkg-config-0.29.2':
  >> 22    configure: error: cannot run C compiled programs.

```

config.log for this build has:
```
conftest.c:11:10: fatal error: 'stdio.h' file not found
#include <stdio.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

However /usr/bin/clang works.

```
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ cat conftest.c 
#include <stdio.h>
int main(void)
{return 0;}
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ clang conftest.c 
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ 
```

2. I cannot run this wrapper outside spack to reproduce issues [by manual build of packages or trying to compile test code]

```
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ /Users/balay/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang conftest.c 
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_PREFIX' is missing.
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ export SPACK_PREFIX=$PWD
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ /Users/balay/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang conftest.c 
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_ENV_PATH' is missing.
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ export SPACK_ENV_PATH=$PWD
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ /Users/balay/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang conftest.c 
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_DEBUG_LOG_DIR' is missing.
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ export SPACK_DEBUG_LOG_DIR=$PWD
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ /Users/balay/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang conftest.c 
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_COMPILER_SPEC' is missing.
balay@ipro^~/spack(xsdk-0.3.0) $ 
```
and so on... How do I invoke this wrapper for manual verification?

 
I see Spack doc says 'xcode-select --install' is required. I guess this will resolve this error.
http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html?highlight=xcode-select

But I'm able to install various packages without it. So Its not clear to me why this wrapper has more requirements than /usr/bin/clang. Previously I've seen this requirement for external compilers - like pgi - or clang installed by brew - but in this case - I'm using clang from XCode.

Note: the following works [when it fails via spack]:
```
balay@ipro^~/spack/var/spack/stage/pkg-config-0.29.2-zggrhmtc22dolyoug5ylkrknom2e3vda/pkg-config-0.29.2 $ CC=/usr/bin/clang ./configure --enable-shared --with-internal-glib

```
